result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert N Matte Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[ma] Cases 14CF268 & 17CF455 called at 11:01am [Court Reporter: Rose Roderick]
Defendant Robert N Matte in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Parson verifies victim rights compliance.

The Court reviews the court records

Scheduling occurs in Case 17CF455.

Sentencing Hearing on Revocation occurs in Case 14CF268:
Parties verify reciept and review of revocation packet; factual corrections made to criminal history by Attorney De La Rosa
The Court verifies review of case including transcript and revocation packet. 

Sentencing Arguments/Recommendations given by Counsel

On Counts #1, #2, and #3, the Court sentences Defendant to serve 9 months in Jefferson County Jail, on EACH count, with Huber privileges; to be served concurrent to each other. 
--172 days credit for time already served given

The Court coverts any outstanding costs, fees, and surcharges to civil judgment.

recess: 11:36am

Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[ml] Cases 14CF268 and 17CF455 called at 3:54PM
Defendant Robert N Matte in court, in custody with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Parson verifies Victim Rights Compliance.
Att De La Rosa requests that these matters be rescheduled, noting that he has been appointed only last week. The State does not object to the Sentencing after Revocation being rescheduled, and notes that file 17CF455 is currently at the Prelim stage.

recess 4:00PM

NEXT: Sentencing After Revocation on 04/18 at 11:00AM (17CF455 to track along for Status)
Attorney De La Rosa
Court's acknowledgement of review of 3/9/22 Status of Counsel
Status of Counsel
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

[MK] cases #14CF268 and #17CF455 called at 10:05am 
Defendant Robert N Matte in court, in custody.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
These cases are scheduled for Sentencing After Revocation in Case #14CF268 and for Status Conference in Case #17CF455 today, however the Court notes that the Public Defender is trying to appoint counsel for Mr. Matte.
Mr. Matte makes a statement that awaiting PD appointment of counsel was the issue a the previous hearing in January [in Case #17CF455].  
The Court sets the matters over  
The Court directs that the Court's JA  get in contact with the Public Defenders Office to inquire why Attorney De La Rosa was not re-appointed to represent Mr. Matte and be back with Mr. Matte here today.  
recess 10:08am

NEXT:  Sentencing After Revocation in Case #14CF268 and Status Conference in Case #17CF455 [JA-note in comments that case is at prelim stage] --both on April 12th at 3:00pm

Case called at 2:18 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Robert N Matte in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court AMENDS Counts #1, #2 & #3 to reflect misdemeanor violations contrary to 948.22(3), Class A misdemeanors.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Counts #1, #2 & #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

On Counts #1, #2 & #3, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
-To undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--Comply with all family court orders regarding child support
--Make all child support payments on time
--Make all payments on arreartages according to the Child Support Agency
--Within 5 days of sentencing (or, if confined, within 5 business days of release from custody), defendant shall report to the child support agency, Jefferson County Courthouse, 311 S. Center Ave. Jefferson Rm.219 to complete case management meeting
--Advise child support office of any employment or address chage within 48 hours of such a change
--To pay costs of $729 ($243 each count)
--To pay $600 DNA Surcharge ($200 each count)
--Not leave the State of Wisconsin without Agent approval
--All payments towards child support and arrearages to be paid through: WISCONSIN SUPPORT COLLECTION TRUST FUND, PO Box 7400 Milwaukee WI 53274-0200 not through DOC
--Court orders that child support & arrearage be paid first before costs

Days credit for time already served: 31 days
Recess: 2:33 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Scheduling order
for return/destruction of exhibits
Jury trial on October 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on September 30, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 17, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Cases 14CF268 & 09PA70 PJ called at 2:01 pm
Defendant Robert N Matte in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel). ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jane Jacobs appears for the Child Support Agency on case 09PA70 PJ.

Attorney De La Rosa provides updated address for the defendant.

As to case14CF268:
Defendant confirms that the DOB listed on the criminal complaint is correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause to support Counts #1 - #3.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $1,500.00 CASH bond, with no special non-monetary conditions:

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 10 day time limit.

As to case 09PA70 PJ:
Attorney Jacobs presents procedural posture of the case.
Attorney De La Rosa informs the Court that SPD will appoint counsel in this case.

Court direct Child Support Office to tender to SPD the document referred to.
Attorney Jacobs and the Court discuss if the right to counsel needs to be signed.
Court finds that the record is sufficient and the Defendant has counsel so no additional paperwork needs to be signed.

Recess: 2:20 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 9/2/14 at 8:30 am (agreed to by the parties) (14CF268)
Order to Show Cause Hearing: 12/4/14 at 9:30 am (09PA70 PJ)
